newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SIMEX Euroyen, JGBs slide on technicals, Nikkei.
newsitem.headline: SIMEX Euroyen, JGBs slide on technicals, Nikkei.

text.p: SIMEX Euroyen and Japanese government bond (JGB) futures headed south on Thursday due to a bearish technical outlook and the Nikkei's resilience in the face of a steep overnight drop on Wall Street.
"JGBs opened firm but they hit resistance at 124.76 and moved down from there. The technical scenario still shows a bear trend," a senior trader at an Asian institution said.
He said market rumours that the Bank of Japan (BOJ) was considering hiking rates by September also weighed on Euroyen and JGB futures.
June JGBs ended at 123.86 against their previous 124.56 after hitting a low of 123.88. Support is seen at the recent contract low of 123.68.
"People are concerned about an over-supply of bonds. Mitsubishi Motor is supposed to issue 80 billion yen next week," the trader said.
December Euroyen, dampened by the weakness in JGBs, stood at 98.90 at 1115 GMT after hitting a low of 98.88 against an IMM close at 98.96. Support is seen at 98.85.
Dealers said a series of comments by key Japanese Finance Ministry official Eisuke Sakakibara had little impact on the market, despite causing a sharp drop in dollar/yen.

Sakakibara told a parliamentary committee it was possible the yen could strengthen to 103 yen to the dollar, causing the dollar to fall by more than a yen, but he later said his comment contained no specific intent regarding the dollar/yen rate.
Eurodollar futures eased on follow-through selling after the U.S. government's quarterly refunding exercise ended with a poor result in its 10-year note auction.
December Eurodollars ended at 93.565 against an IMM close at 93.610 on volume of 16,133 lots.
